Tokens.text: My friend Alf went missing and the people in the town started to act strange...

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Do you have a direction to start with? ","First Mission Intro"
Tokens.name: linkgoto
Tokens.text: (link-goto:"Do you have a direction to start with? ","First Mission Intro")

tokens.innerText: Do you have a direction to start with?
tokens.text: "Do you have a direction to start with? "

Tokens.text: I don't want to start with accusations...

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Ok... I'm ready to start ","First Mission Intro"
Tokens.name: linkgoto
Tokens.text: (link-goto:"Ok... I'm ready to start ","First Mission Intro")
I was looking at Alfs' house and discover a weird passage in his basement.
When I went in I discover a whole underground area.
The shpae... it looked familiar I... I search In the books and found what it means.

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Tell me more ","BSP Rooms And RPC"
Tokens.name: linkgoto

Tokens.text: Alf is the chef of the town and a good friend of mine.
After he didn't open his shop in the morning I went to look for him but couldn't find him anywhere.

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Ok... I'm ready to start ","First Mission Intro"
Tokens.name: linkgoto
Tokens.text: (link-goto:"Ok... I'm ready to start ","First Mission Intro")
It looks like Binary Space Partitioning for rooms with Random Point Connect.

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for rooms? ","BSP Rooms mission1"
Tokens.name: linkgoto
Tokens.text: (link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for rooms? ","BSP Rooms mission1")

It Works by dividing the map into a series of rectangles, and then placing a room in each one on the map. The rectangle can be split either vertically or horizontally, and the minimum size of the split is determined based on the minimum size of the rooms.

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Ok I think I'm raedy ","First Mission"
Tokens.name: linkgoto

Tokens.text: Algorithm that works by first iterating through the list of rooms created by the room generation algorithm.  For each corridor it draws, it selects a random point at the edge of each of the rooms and connects. If the points are parallel, the algorithm will draw a straight corridor in the appropriate vertical or horizontal direction. If the points are not parallel, the algorithm will draw a forked corridor made up of three straight corridors in order to connect the points.

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for rooms? ","BSP Rooms mission1"
Tokens.name: linkgoto
Tokens.text: (link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for rooms? ","BSP Rooms mission1")

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Ok I think I'm raedy ","First Mission"
Tokens.name: linkgoto

Tokens.text: Go to Alf's house right here behind the mayor's back.
Search for Alf and return with more details...
I'm so sad to heat that.. I wanted to belive he will be ok.
While you were gone I discovered that the problem is bigger then I thought, all the town is built on an undergroung tombs.
When I entered my basment I discover a hole like at Alfs house.
The shpae was built by Binary Space Partitioning for Rooms and Binary Space Partitioning for Corridors.

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for rooms? ","BSP Rooms mission2"
Tokens.name: linkgoto
Tokens.text: (link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for rooms? ","BSP Rooms mission2")

Tokens.name: linkgoto
Tokens.text: (link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for corridors? ","BSP Corridors mission2")
My name is Granny Iga and I'm the mayor of this beautiful town.

Tokens.innerText: [[I know the truth about you! ->Mayor Exposed]]

tokens.innerText: link-goto:"I know the truth about you! ","Mayor Exposed"
tokens.name: linkgoto
tokens.text: (link-goto:"I know the truth about you! ","Mayor Exposed")

tokens.innerText: I know the truth about you!

Tokens.text: You are smarter then i thought!

It Works by dividing the map into a series of rectangles, and then placing a room in each one on the map. The rectangle can be split either vertically or horizontally, and the minimum size of the split is determined based on the minimum size of the rooms.

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for corridors? ","BSP Corridors mission2"
Tokens.name: linkgoto
Tokens.text: (link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for corridors? ","BSP Corridors mission2")

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Ok I think I'm raedy ","Second Mission"
Tokens.name: linkgoto

Tokens.text: Using the tree structure used by BSP Rooms algorithm. It sorts through the sub leaves, connecting each bottom leaf to its partner that shares a parent. When all sub leafs are paired in connects one out of each pair to another pair, until all sub-leafs containing rooms are connected.

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for rooms? ","BSP Rooms mission2"
Tokens.name: linkgoto
Tokens.text: (link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for rooms? ","BSP Rooms mission2")

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Ok I think I'm raedy ","Second Mission"
Tokens.name: linkgoto

Tokens.text: Go to my house to my left (your right).
Explore the tomb and return with more information.

tokens.innerText: link-goto:"I found an open coffin... ","Mission 2 Completed"
tokens.name: linkgoto

Tokens.text: What? an open coffin? this is worst then I thought.
While you were gone Everett said she was attacked in her house.

Tokens.innerText:
Thank god you are here!
The Skeletons came and attack me in the middle of the night.
They hold a big book, I think you should search it out, it looked dangerous.

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Ok I think I'm ready ","Mission 3 Completed"
Tokens.name: linkgoto

Tokens.text: Similar to RPC it also selects vertex between the rooms and starts drawing a line the first vertex incrementing a randomly chosen amount of vertices in the direction of the second, When the corridor is being made by DW, the algorithm do it in steps. Each step adds a corridor of a random length that goes in the direction of the end point.

Tokens.innerText:
I saw you got the book of the "Algorithm Magic", it used to belong to a very powerful witch a long time ago. I think she was waking from the coffin you found at my house.
[[I'm Ready for my next mission ->Firth Mission]]

tokens.innerText: I'm Ready for my next mission

Tokens.text: After the calculations I did I think the next template that will appear is
Binary Space Partitioning for rooms and Drunkards Walk.

Tokens.innerText: link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for rooms? ","BSP Rooms mission3"
Tokens.name: linkgoto
Tokens.text: (link-goto:"Binary Space Partitioning for rooms? ","BSP Rooms mission3")
While you were gone I went to Irvin house, I saw a huge skeleton walking around. I check in my books, this tomb is build with Random Room Placement and Random Point Connect.
Algorithms that starts by randomly generating a room of a random width and length, the randomness of the size of the room is controlled by maximum and minimum allowed lengths.

Algorithm that works by first iterating through the list of rooms created by the room generation algorithm.  For each corridor it draws, it selects a random point at the edge of each of the rooms and connects. If the points are parallel, the algorithm will draw a straight corridor in the appropriate vertical or horizontal direction. If the points are not parallel, the algorithm will draw a forked corridor made up of three straight corridors in order to connect the points.

Tokens.innerText: Find and kill the skeleton at Irvin house.

tokens.text: Find and kill the skeleton at Irvin house.

Good job!
Now theres only one thing left to do.
I think the witch has strike now because she gain power over years.

Tokens.text: I think the mayor is the evil witch!
Talk to her and confront her!
I live here on you'r right.
